seo.title_override: Phoenix AZ Mattress Disposal Guide 2026 | Easy & Legal
seo.meta_desc_override: Avoid Phoenix's hefty $2,500 illegal dumping fine! Our 2026 guide covers legal mattress disposal options, including curbside pickup and recycling, for Phoenix, AZ residents.

hero_hook: Avoid the hassle and potential $2,500 fine when getting rid of your old mattress in the dry Phoenix heat.
neighborhoods: Arcadia, Biltmore, Camelback East, Downtown Phoenix, Encanto, Garfield, Coronado, Roosevelt Row, Willo, Alhambra, Laveen, Maryvale, Ahwatukee Foothills, Deer Valley, North Mountain

curbside_rules.mattress_specific_rule: Materials such as furniture, small appliances, toilets, and large amounts of vegetation are often considered bulk trash.
curbside_rules.placement_time: Have your items placed by 5:30 a.m. on your scheduled appointment date. Make sure you have your appointment scheduled before you begin placing your bulk items at the curb (no more than 7 days ahead of your scheduled date). It is a violation of city ordinance to place trash out more than 7 days before your scheduled appointment.
curbside_rules.size_limits: Set bulk items out in a single pile no larger than ten (10) cubic yards per residence​ (all material should be placed no more than 5 feet from the street/curb or front edge of the property). Cut tree trimmings down to less than 12 inches in diameter and 4 feet in length​. Don't Include: More than ten (10) cubic yards of bulk trash per residence. More than 2 wooden pallets. Materials such as bricks, concrete, dirt, rocks, asphalt, and roofing shingles/tiles. Construction or demolition materials in excess of 25 pounds or over four feet long. Metal or car parts in excess of 20 pounds or over four feet long. Tires, any shape or size. Glass such as windows, shower doors, patio doors, mirrors, fluorescent tubes, etc. Tree trunks or stumps longer than 4 feet and bigger than 12 inches in diameter. Large appliances that use refrigerants such as freezers, refrigerators and air conditioners.
curbside_rules.the_catch: There are specific guidelines that must be followed or we cannot collect bulk trash from your property. Customers will have four (4) collection opportunities each year. Appointments that are canceled at least 3 business days ahead of time will not count against your four total appointments for the year. Do not place pile on top of water meters. Keep pile at least 5 feet aw

seo.title_override: Philly Mattress Disposal Guide 2026: Rules & Tips
seo.meta_desc_override: Avoid Philadelphia's $300-$1,000 mattress disposal fines! Learn the rules for proper disposal, including curbside pickup options, to keep your Philly streets clean.

hero_hook: Navigating Philadelphia's mattress disposal rules can be tricky, especially with fines and rainy weather looming.
neighborhoods: Fishtown, Northern Liberties, Rittenhouse Square, Old City, Manayunk, Chestnut Hill, Graduate Hospital, Point Breeze, Queen Village, East Passyunk Crossing, University City, Kensington, Brewerytown, Fairmount, Bella Vista

curbside_rules.placement_time: Place items at your normal collection point (curbside or rear driveway) the evening before your pickup date (no earlier than 5:00 p.m. during Fall and Winter and 7:00 p.m. in Spring and Summer). Ensure items are curbside by 7:00 a.m. on pickup day.
curbside_rules.size_limits: Philadelphia residents can schedule bulk item pickups for up to four (4) items per appointment. Passenger car tires (rims removed; 4 tires = 1 bulk item). The Department of Sanitation will continue to collect up to two (2) large items (non-metal) per household on regularly scheduled trash collection days.
curbside_rules.the_catch: Larger apartment buildings, condominiums, and commercial properties are not eligible for the program and must use private haulers. The city will not enter homes to collect items. Residents are responsible for ensuring items are placed in accessible locations on time. The city is not liable for items taken before pickup. Sanitation will not collect items that are not included in the Bulk Collection program, such as household trash and mattresses (wrapped in plastic), hazardous, flammable, or explosive materials, auto parts, and construction or demolition debris.
curbside_rules.schedule_logic: Residents can schedule appointments through the Department of Sanitation’s website or by contacting 311. Appointments are limited and will be scheduled on a first-come, first-serve basis. After scheduling, you’ll receive an email with: Pickup Code: Mark items for pick-up with this 4-letter code. Service Request Number: Use this for any follo

weather_profile.rejection_risk_copy: WARNING: Philadelphia averages 100+ rainy days per year. If your mattress gets wet before pickup, the city WILL NOT take it (too heavy, mold risk). Our haulers pick up from inside your home — rain or shine.

seo.title_override: San Diego Mattress Disposal & Recycling Guide 2026
seo.meta_desc_override: Navigate San Diego mattress disposal rules and avoid a $1,000 fine. Learn about recycling options and check city guidelines for curbside pickup.

hero_hook: Disposing of an old mattress in San Diego can be a costly headache if not done right.
neighborhoods: Pacific Beach, La Jolla, North Park, South Park, Hillcrest, Little Italy, Gaslamp Quarter, Mission Beach, Ocean Beach, Point Loma, Old Town, Mira Mesa, Carmel Valley, Rancho Bernardo, University City

drop_off_locations.name: The Mattress Collection Site
drop_off_locations.address: 5161 Convoy St., San Diego, CA 92111
drop_off_locations.hours: Monday to Friday from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. The site is closed on Saturdays and Sundays.
drop_off_locations.tipping_fee: Free for mattresses and box springs. Landfill fees may apply if your mattresses are brought in with other waste.
drop_off_locations.notes: Accepts mattresses, box springs, and futon mattresses (must be removed from frame or base). Items must not be severely damaged, wet, twisted, frozen, soiled or infested with bedbugs. No drop-off limit. The site is CLOSED on the following holidays: New Year’s Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day. Does not accept mattress pads or toppers, sleeping bags and cots, pillows, cushions, blankets, sheets and other loose bedding, car beds, infant carriers, lounge pads or crib bumpers, juvenile products (carriages, baskets, cribs, crib mattresses, bassinets, dressing tables, dressing table pads, strollers and playpens, crib bumpers or their pads), waterbeds, collapsible rollaway beds, camping air mattresses, foldout sofa beds, futon frames/bases, or household furniture. Mattresses or box springs in a cardboard box or plastic bag are not accepted.

competitor_comparison.value_prop: No franchise fees. Just local haulers.

seo.title_override: San Jose Mattress Disposal Guide 2026 | Eco-Friendly
seo.meta_desc_override: San Jose mattress disposal made easy! Avoid fines: $2,500 (1st), $5,000 (2nd), $10,000 (3rd+ offense). Learn about curbside pickup & eco-friendly options.

hero_hook: Don't let mattress disposal stress you out in San Jose, especially with fines up to $10,000 for illegal dumping.
neighborhoods: Willow Glen, Rose Garden, Almaden Valley, Evergreen, Berryessa, Cambrian Park, Naglee Park, Japantown, Silver Creek, Santa Teresa, West San Jose, North San Jose, East San Jose, Downtown San Jose, Edenvale

curbside_rules.mattress_specific_rule: Residents in homes and mobile home parks can have large items/junk (such as mattresses, sofas, refrigerators, tires, and more) collected curbside for free by their recycling collection company. Residents can schedule unlimited junk pickups for free.
curbside_rules.size_limits: Requests may include up to 12 items for pickup.
curbside_rules.the_catch: All items must be generated from your home. If you live in a multi-family complex, check with your property manager for instructions on where to place items for your Junk Pickup appointment.
curbside_rules.schedule_logic: Appointments can be scheduled by visiting 311.SanJoseCA.gov, dialing 3-1-1, or calling (408) 535-3500. Residents in homes and mobile home parks can also schedule a pickup by calling their recycling collection company directly. Apartment and condominium residents can contact their property managers or GreenTeam of San Jose at (408) 282-4400 to arrange for free pickups.

seo.title_override: Seattle Mattress Disposal Guide 2026: Easy & Eco-Friendly
seo.meta_desc_override: Seattle mattress disposal made easy! Avoid fines up to $5,000 with our 2026 guide. Learn about convenient curbside pickup options & eco-friendly recycling.

hero_hook: Don't let Seattle's notorious rain make disposing of your old mattress a soggy, heavy burden.
neighborhoods: Ballard, Capitol Hill, Queen Anne, Fremont, West Seattle, Columbia City, Wallingford, Greenwood, Ravenna, University District, Belltown, Downtown, South Lake Union, Beacon Hill, Madrona

curbside_rules.placement_time: On collection day, set out special items where you would normally have your solid waste service collected. Items must be out at the collection point by 7:00 a.m. on that collection day.
curbside_rules.the_catch: The utility account holder must make the request. The person(s) responsible for the combined utility bill must be able to authorize charges on the account. Costs vary by the type of item collected. For safety reasons, please remove any refrigerator and freezer doors that have latches. Items made of absorbent material must have a waterproof cover on rainy days. Items placed outside must be on a flat, level surface (no stairs) and easily accessible from the street. If the normal solid waste location is a secured area, please place the bulky item outside.
curbside_rules.schedule_logic: Schedule a special item pickup To request the collection of large or hard to dispose of items at your home, schedule online or call Seattle Public Utilities Customer Service at (206) 684-3000. Special items will be collected on the next regular garbage collection day, after the pickup has been scheduled. UDP customers that live in a single-family home and receive a Seattle Public Utilities bill in their name can get two free special item pickups per year when calling for collection.

weather_profile.rejection_risk_copy: WARNING: Seattle averages 100+ rainy days per year. If your mattress gets wet before pickup, the city WILL NOT take it (too heavy, mold risk). Our haulers pick up from inside your home — rain or shine.

seo.title_override: Boston MA Mattress Disposal Guide 2026: Easy & Legal Options
seo.meta_desc_override: No fines for proper disposal! Discover Boston, MA's 2026 mattress disposal rules, including curbside pickup options. Your guide to hassle-free removal.

hero_hook: Navigating Boston's narrow streets and stairs with an old mattress can be a real headache, especially on a rainy day.
neighborhoods: Beacon Hill, Back Bay, North End, South End, Fenway-Kenmore, Seaport District, Dorchester, Roxbury, Jamaica Plain, Roslindale, West Roxbury, Hyde Park, Mattapan, Charlestown, East Boston

curbside_rules.mattress_specific_rule: The City of Boston requires an appointment for the collection of all mattresses and box springs. The City of Boston will not collect mattresses or box springs with your curbside trash. You must schedule an appointment for curbside pick-up. Place your mattress on the curb by 6 a.m. on the day of your appointment, or after 5 p.m. the night before.
curbside_rules.placement_time: Place your mattress on the curb by 6 a.m. on the day of your appointment, or after 5 p.m. the night before.
curbside_rules.the_catch: The City only picks-up mattresses from residents who live in buildings with six units or fewer. If you live in a building with more than six units, you will need to contact your property manager for proper mattress disposal. We cannot collect mattresses on private property. Mattresses must be in a publicly accessible space. The City of Boston will not collect any mattress without an appointment.
curbside_rules.schedule_logic: You must schedule an appointment for curbside pick-up online.

weather_profile.rejection_risk_copy: WARNING: Boston averages 100+ rainy days per year. If your mattress gets wet before pickup, the city WILL NOT take it (too heavy, mold risk). Our haulers pick up from inside your home — rain or shine.

drop_off_locations.notes: Open for all City of Miami residents to dispose of their bulky items and yard trash. A MAXIMUM OF ONE (1) TRIP PER DAY ALLOWED (Each trip is no more than a pickup truck load). WILL NOT ACCEPT THE FOLLOWING: VEHICLES WITH COMMERCIAL MARKINGS, DUMP-TYPE OR PANEL TYPE TRUCKS, COMMERCIAL TRUCKS OR VANS OR MATERIALS FROM COMMERCIAL CONTRACTORS. Accepts: HOUSEHOLD FURNITURE ex. bed frames, dressers, dining tables, chairs, sofa, mattresses, large empty boxes, etc. HOUSEHOLD ELECTRONICS ex. computer monitors, printers, scanners, fax machines, keyboards, laptops, TV's, VCR & DVD players, cellular phones, small kitchen appliances such as toasters, toaster ovens, blenders, mixers, etc. WHITE GOODS ex. large appliances such as refrigerators, stoves, microwaves, dishwashers, etc. CLEAN YARD TRASH ex. tree cuttings, yard clippings, shrubbery and hedge trimmings, and leaves and grass (bagged).
